conversation.message: Hello School_B. I’m Student_B. I’m exploring my options this round and wanted to learn a bit more about what you prioritize in admitted students and what your program’s strengths are. I’m interested in keeping School_B as a serious option and would appreciate any details you can share.
conversation.thought: School_B is 4th on my true list. I have strong priority at School_C (1st) and decent at School_E (2nd), so I should not commit to School_B in round 1. However, School_B ranks me 2nd (after Student_A), so it can be a solid fallback if my top choices fill. Best move is to TALK to keep the option warm without locking in a lower-ranked match.

conversation.message:
Hi Student_B—thanks for reaching out. We prioritize students who show strong academic readiness, consistent effort over time, and a clear fit with our community (collaboration, curiosity, and follow-through). School_B’s strengths are:
- Rigorous core academics with structured support (office hours/tutoring) so motivated students can push further.
- Strong student community and advising: we focus on helping students set goals early and stay on track.
- Breadth of activities and leadership opportunities—students who want to contribute can find a place quickly.

To help you evaluate fit: what are you most focused on in high school (advanced academics, specific subjects, clubs/leadership, support structure, campus culture)? Also, where does School_B currently sit on your shortlist relative to your other options? If you decide School_B is a top choice, I encourage you to apply—we’re very interested in you.
conversation.thought: Student_B is #2 on School_B's true priority list, so I should actively appeal and keep them engaged. They are currently just TALKing, so I cannot accept yet. Given Student_B prefers School_E > School_C > School_D > School_B, I need to differentiate and encourage an APPLY while signaling strong interest without committing prematurely.

conversation.message: Hello School_A, I’m Student_D. School_A is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. I’m ready to commit and would be grateful for your consideration. [APPLY]

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_A. We’re impressed by your commitment, and we would be very happy to have you join our community. We are pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_A.
